intro: Impatiens majungensis, commonly known as the Majungensis Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an upright herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot.
